text: Hi folks, I'm Julie from GiveDirectly. We're trying to get our transactional single send api emails set up in python but having some trouble with error handling. The response for the *`/marketing/v3/transactional/single-email/send`* endpoint is <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing/transactional-emails|documented> to contain a `sendResult` key, but I get a key error when I try to access it on the `response.json()` I get from posting to that endpoint. Anyone have thoughts on why it's missing? Looks like I'm just getting the keys `statusId`, `status`  and `requestedAt` but many more keys are documented.

As I can see, there are only 3 params in response statusId, status, and requestedAt

Most of the keys are documented in the API request parameter.
I see that now...it's just that the endpoint page says there is a sendResult, and *sometimes* i see the sendResult key, just can't figure out when it appears and when it doesn't
e.g. if I POST to this endpoint with an invalid template id, I get the sendResult key with value "error"
Can you please attach a screenshot for the second case as well i.e. `sendResult key with value "error"`?

Hi all,

I am creating a drag n drop email template in the design tool. The problem I am having is that whenever the width goes under 493px, some modules will be put under each other instead of next to each other. (Check screenshots)

I’ve read about the Media queries but I just don’t know how to implement them succesfully.

I’ve shared some screenshots of my approach so far.

Does anyone know what to do?
The media query is missing { } around what you're trying to target. The classes also don't seem to match, as I don't see -1 or -2 anywhere, and they need a comma between class names.
Hi, I created a Rich Text module and added it to the body of a custom template. Every time I add an image to it, it loads fine in the Editor and Preview but won't load in the actual email received.
